required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Chart Review on the Use of Biologics in Monotherapy for the Treatment of Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Chart Review on the Use of Biologics in Monotherapy for the Treatment of Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This non-interventional, retrospective, cross sectional chart review study will evaluate the management of rheumatoid arthritis patients with a biologic in monotherapy. Data from eligible patients will be collected from the patient's last visit on the prior rheumatoid arthritis treatment and from the most recent visit for the biological monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage (%) of Participants Receiving Biologic Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (bDMARDs) in Monotherapy as Current Treatment for RA According to National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) Guidelines by Type of bDMARD
primary_outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Current bDMARDs were defined as those with a start date on or after the date of collection, or those with a start date before the date of collection and an end date on or after the date of collection. NICE guidelines recommend the participants with severe active RA who inadequately responded to prior DMARD treatment (trial of 2 DMARDs, one which includes methotrexate) and were intolerant to methotrexate or the treatment with methotrexate considered inappropriate be treated with a biologic DMARD monotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Treated With Traditional DMARDs as Their Previous Treatment for RA by Type of DMARD
primary_outcome.description: Traditional DMARDS for RA treatment include methotrexate, sulfasalazine, leflunomide, hydroxychloroquine, gold compounds, penicillamine, cyclosporine, azathioprine, chlorambucil, mercaptopurine, and mycophenolate mofetil medications. Previous RA treatment included all the treatments received prior to switching to current RA treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD and Concomitant Traditional DMARD Regimen as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy by Type of bDMARD
primary_outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs with concomitant traditional DMARD as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD Monotherapy as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy
primary_outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs in monotherapy as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Concomitant Treatment Other Than DMARDs for RA by Type of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: All corticosteroids and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs taken as previous and current treatments for RA were coded according to the Roche international non-proprietary name dictionary.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Reason for Choosing Previous and Current bDMARDs in Monotherapy
primary_outcome.description: Both previous and current bDMARDs were presented together for each subgroup, therefore the percentage of participants under each reason did not add up to 100%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Disease Activity Score of 28 Joint Count (DAS28) by Either Erythrocyte Sedimentation Ratio (ESR) or C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 was calculated from the tender joint count (TJC) of 28 joints, swollen joint count (SJC) of 28 joints, ESR (in millimeters/hour) or CRP (in milligrams/liter), and the participant's global assessment of disease activity (visual analog scale: 0=no disease activity to 100=maximum disease activity). The formula for calculating DAS28 score using ESR value is: 0.56 x square root (√) of TJC + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.70 x log natural (ESR) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score. The formula for calculating DAS28 score using CRP value is: 0.56 x √(TJC) + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.36 x log natural (CRP+1) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score +0.96. The DAS28 score range was 0-9.4 where higher scores represented higher disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Tender Joints and Swollen Joints and Non-Evaluable DAS 28 Joints When Assessed Using Both ESR and CRP Methods
secondary_outcome.description: DAS28 was calculated from the tender joint count (TJC) of 28 joints, swollen joint count (SJC) of 28 joints, ESR (in millimeters/hour) or CRP (in milligrams/liter), and the participant's global assessment of disease activity (visual analog scale: 0=no disease activity to 100=maximum disease activity). TJC and SJC assessed as part of the DAS28 outcome measure assessment were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Treatment With the Current bDMARD Usage in Monotherapy
Duration of Treatment With bDMARDs in Monotherapy as Previous Treatment for RA
Duration of Treatment of bDMARD Administered With Concomitant Traditional DMARD as Previous Treatment for RA

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated with a biologic in monotherapy for rheumatoid arthritis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 18 years of age
- Diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis by a Rheumatologist
- Patient being prescribed with a biologic in monotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) Cohort
group.description: Participants on biologic disease modifying anti-rheumatic drug (bDMARD) monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

baseline.population: Included all the participants who entered the retrospective chart review.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

outcome.title: Percentage (%) of Participants Receiving Biologic Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (bDMARDs) in Monotherapy as Current Treatment for RA According to National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) Guidelines by Type of bDMARD
outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Current bDMARDs were defined as those with a start date on or after the date of collection, or those with a start date before the date of collection and an end date on or after the date of collection. NICE guidelines recommend the participants with severe active RA who inadequately responded to prior DMARD treatment (trial of 2 DMARDs, one which includes methotrexate) and were intolerant to methotrexate or the treatment with methotrexate considered inappropriate be treated with a biologic DMARD monotherapy.
outcome.population: Included all the participants who entered the retrospective chart review.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Percentage (%) of Participants Receiving Biologic Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (bDMARDs) in Monotherapy as Current Treatment for RA According to National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) Guidelines by Type of bDMARD
measure.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Current bDMARDs were defined as those with a start date on or after the date of collection, or those with a start date before the date of collection and an end date on or after the date of collection. NICE guidelines recommend the participants with severe active RA who inadequately responded to prior DMARD treatment (trial of 2 DMARDs, one which includes methotrexate) and were intolerant to methotrexate or the treatment with methotrexate considered inappropriate be treated with a biologic DMARD monotherapy.
measure.population: Included all the participants who entered the retrospective chart review.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Treated With Traditional DMARDs as Their Previous Treatment for RA by Type of DMARD
outcome.description: Traditional DMARDS for RA treatment include methotrexate, sulfasalazine, leflunomide, hydroxychloroquine, gold compounds, penicillamine, cyclosporine, azathioprine, chlorambucil, mercaptopurine, and mycophenolate mofetil medications. Previous RA treatment included all the treatments received prior to switching to current RA treatment.
outcome.population: Included all the participants who took any past traditional DMARDs.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Treated With Traditional DMARDs as Their Previous Treatment for RA by Type of DMARD
measure.description: Traditional DMARDS for RA treatment include methotrexate, sulfasalazine, leflunomide, hydroxychloroquine, gold compounds, penicillamine, cyclosporine, azathioprine, chlorambucil, mercaptopurine, and mycophenolate mofetil medications. Previous RA treatment included all the treatments received prior to switching to current RA treatment.
measure.population: Included all the participants who took any past traditional DMARDs.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD and Concomitant Traditional DMARD Regimen as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy by Type of bDMARD
outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs with concomitant traditional DMARD as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.
outcome.population: Included participants who were previously treated with any bDMARD with concomitant traditional DMARD prior to switch to bDMARD monotherapy as current RA treatment.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD and Concomitant Traditional DMARD Regimen as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy by Type of bDMARD
measure.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs with concomitant traditional DMARD as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.
measure.population: Included participants who were previously treated with any bDMARD with concomitant traditional DMARD prior to switch to bDMARD monotherapy as current RA treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD Monotherapy as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy
outcome.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs in monotherapy as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.
outcome.population: Included participants who received bDMARD as monotherapy as previous treatment prior to switch to bDMARD monotherapy as current treatment.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With bDMARD Monotherapy as Previous RA Treatment at Anytime Prior to Switch to bDMARD Monotherapy
measure.description: bDMARDS for RA treatment include etanercept, adalimumab, tocilizumab, rituximab, certolizumab pegol, infliximab, golimumab, abatacept and anakinra medications. Only the most frequently used (> 10% of participants) bDMARDs in monotherapy as previous treatment for RA were reported. If a participant was recorded to have been treated with a single bDMARD more than once, the participant was counted only once per type of bDMARD. If participant received 2 different types of bDMARDs as part of their previous treatment, the participant was counted twice, once per each type of bDMARD; therefore, the percentage of participants did not add up to 100%.
measure.population: Included participants who received bDMARD as monotherapy as previous treatment prior to switch to bDMARD monotherapy as current treatment.

outcome.title: Assessment of Disease Activity Score of 28 Joint Count (DAS28) by Either Erythrocyte Sedimentation Ratio (ESR) or C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
outcome.description: DAS28 was calculated from the tender joint count (TJC) of 28 joints, swollen joint count (SJC) of 28 joints, ESR (in millimeters/hour) or CRP (in milligrams/liter), and the participant's global assessment of disease activity (visual analog scale: 0=no disease activity to 100=maximum disease activity). The formula for calculating DAS28 score using ESR value is: 0.56 x square root (√) of TJC + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.70 x log natural (ESR) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score. The formula for calculating DAS28 score using CRP value is: 0.56 x √(TJC) + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.36 x log natural (CRP+1) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score +0.96. The DAS28 score range was 0-9.4 where higher scores represented higher disease activity.
outcome.population: Included the number of participants who were evaluable for DAS28 assessment. "n" represents the number of participants who were evaluable for that particular assessment.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Assessment of Disease Activity Score of 28 Joint Count (DAS28) by Either Erythrocyte Sedimentation Ratio (ESR) or C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
measure.description: DAS28 was calculated from the tender joint count (TJC) of 28 joints, swollen joint count (SJC) of 28 joints, ESR (in millimeters/hour) or CRP (in milligrams/liter), and the participant's global assessment of disease activity (visual analog scale: 0=no disease activity to 100=maximum disease activity). The formula for calculating DAS28 score using ESR value is: 0.56 x square root (√) of TJC + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.70 x log natural (ESR) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score. The formula for calculating DAS28 score using CRP value is: 0.56 x √(TJC) + 0.28 x √(SJC) + 0.36 x log natural (CRP+1) + 0.014 x global assessment of RA score +0.96. The DAS28 score range was 0-9.4 where higher scores represented higher disease activity.
measure.population: Included the number of participants who were evaluable for DAS28 assessment. "n" represents the number of participants who were evaluable for that particular assessment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Concomitant Treatment Other Than DMARDs for RA by Type of Treatment
outcome.description: All corticosteroids and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs taken as previous and current treatments for RA were coded according to the Roche international non-proprietary name dictionary.
outcome.population: Included all the participants who entered the retrospective chart review.

outcome.title: Duration of Treatment With the Current bDMARD Usage in Monotherapy
outcome.population: Included all participants who received bDMARD monotherapy as their current treatment for RA. "n is the number of participants who received that particular bDMARD as their current RA treatment.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

measure.title: Duration of Treatment With the Current bDMARD Usage in Monotherapy
measure.population: Included all participants who received bDMARD monotherapy as their current treatment for RA. "n is the number of participants who received that particular bDMARD as their current RA treatment.

outcome.title: Duration of Treatment With bDMARDs in Monotherapy as Previous Treatment for RA
outcome.population: Included participants treated with a bDMARD monotherapy as previous treatment for RA prior to switch to current bDMARD monotherapy. "n" is the number of participants who received particular bDMARD as previous RA treatment.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

outcome.population: Included participants who were treated with a bDMARD with concomitant traditional DMARD as previous treatment for RA. "n" is the number of participants who received particular bDMARD as previous RA treatment.

measure.title: Duration of Treatment of bDMARD Administered With Concomitant Traditional DMARD as Previous Treatment for RA
measure.population: Included participants who were treated with a bDMARD with concomitant traditional DMARD as previous treatment for RA. "n" is the number of participants who received particular bDMARD as previous RA treatment.

reported_events.desc: Adverse events data were collected retrospectively for participants treated with rituximab or tocilizumab only.

group.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Cohort
group.description: Participants on bDMARD monotherapy for RA and on any RA treatment in the past were observed and data was collected retrospectively from a chart review for approximately 9 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
